title: Plastic straws are among the top 10 marine debris items - SurferToday.com
body: As Surfrider chapters around the country will tell you, plastic straws suck," conclude Surfrider. Straws are among the top 10 marine debris items. They are made of polypropylene, a petroleum bi-product that also fuels our vehicles. Americans use enough straws to fill 46,400 large school buses per year. Ready to ban plastics from your life?
readable_content:
- User (2023-12-08): I came across this article about the impact of plastic straws on marine debris. Did you know that 500 million straws are used daily in the United States? 
Miami Beach, Florida, was the first US city to prohibit beachside restaurants from using plastic straws, and now Surfrider Foundation is advocating for a change in the West Coast with San Francisco potentially being the next city to take action.
There are several alternatives to plastic straws, such as paper straws, bamboo straws, stainless steel straws, or corn-based plastic straws. The article also highlights the significant impact individuals can have by choosing not to use straws.
Plastic straws are among the top 10 marine debris items and are made of polypropylene, a petroleum bi-product. Americans use enough straws to fill 46,400 large school buses per year. It's an eye-opening read!
